summary: You know with all the controls, buttons, joysticks, touchpads, etc you’d think games would be more difficult now. But honestly,...
body: You know with all the controls, buttons, joysticks, touchpads, etc you’d think games would be more difficult now. But honestly, after playing the NES Classic these games are so much harder with fewer options to control characters, how odd. Perfecting the art of the last minute jump is a skill I’ve lost over time. Thankfully the ability to save has been incorporated cause nothing like spending hours on a game then having to turn it off because it’s dinner time. But I also remember how many times I would play Super Mario Bros constantly over and over, there’s no variation yet it remains fun. They just don’t make games like they used to.

Perfecting the art of the last minute jump is a skill I’ve lost over time. Thankfully the ability to save has been incorporated cause nothing like spending hours on a game then having to turn it off because it’s dinner time. But I also remember how many times I would play Super Mario Bros constantly over and over, there’s no variation yet it remains fun. They just don’t make games like they used to.

But honestly, after playing the NES Classic these games are so much harder with fewer options to control characters, how odd. Perfecting the art of the last minute jump is a skill I’ve lost over time. Thankfully the ability to save has been incorporated cause nothing like spending hours on a game then having to turn it off because it’s dinner time. But I also remember how many times I would play Super Mario Bros constantly over and over, there’s no variation yet it remains fun. They just don’t make games like they used to.

But honestly, after playing the NES Classic these games are so much harder with fewer options to control characters, how odd. Perfecting the art of the last minute jump is a skill I’ve lost over time. Thankfully the ability to save has been incorporated cause nothing like spending hours on a game then having to turn it off because it’s dinner time. But I also remember how many times I would play Super Mario Bros constantly over and over, there’s no variation yet it remains fun. They just don’t make games like they used to.

blog.name: acaddicts
blog.title: Animal Crossing Addicts
blog.description: Welcome to AC Addicts! We hope you enjoy it here!

summary: ? Did You Know ? - Gulliver! Gulliver is a seagull in the AC series, and he rewards the player with rare furniture items - often...
caption:
? Did You Know ? - Gulliver!

Gulliver is a seagull in the AC series, and he rewards the player with rare furniture items - often artefacts from around the world which cannot be obtained anywhere else in-game. Gulliver’s name is in reference to the famous book by Jonathan Swift - Gulliver’s travels, where a man named Gulliver travels to the far corners of the earth, before being shipwrecked and landing on a previously undiscovered land. There has also been a film adaptation of Gulliver’s travels recently (for those of you who are big on your movies), starring Jack Black :D And now back to the story! xD

Gulliver has appeared throughout the series, however has appeared differently in various games, so we’re firstly going to start with how most of us commonly know Gulliver.

Gulliver is, exactly as his inspiration, a sailor who washes up on the player’s beach in Animal Crossing GC (the original Gamecube game), as well as in Animal Crossing: New Leaf. He often appears dazed and sleepy, as if he’s just recovering from a big event at sea (such as a shipwreck) - which is why it takes the player several attempts at talking to him before he finally wakes up. In New Leaf, he quizzes the player on where he’s been, and it’s up to the player to correctly guess the country in order to receive the rare furniture item. In Animal Crossing GC, this is similar except for when the player travels to the island, they may see Gulliver floating in the water. When they return to their town, they will be able to find Gulliver on one of their beaches.

Now for those of you who played Wild World and City Folk, you were introduced to Gulliver’s highly interesting alter-ego. For those of you who don’t know, in Wild World and City Folk, Gulliver swapped the sea for space and flies around in a UFO. The player upon seeing the UFO in the sky can shoot it down with a slingshot (oh the old days of when you could fire a slingshot and watch it ping straight up into the sky for miles xD). Once the UFO crash lands, parts of the UFO are scattered around town for the player to find. Upon gathering all of these UFO parts and bringing them back to Gulliver, the player is then rewarded with rare furniture. In City Folk, he travels much faster so you have to be quick with your slingshot! He will crash land on the beach and this time only be missing one piece of his UFO, which can be exchanged for a rare furniture item.

Finally for those of you who have seen the Animal Crossing Movie, you will have also noticed Gulliver’s UFO makes an appearance yet again. Gulliver in the movie is said to be an alien, and he appears when his UFO crash lands into Animal Village, enlisting the help of the villagers to recover his missing UFO parts.

And that’s all on our favourite travelling Seagull! :D I did have a thought that it may have been in relation to Gulliver’s travels so I was pleased to find that link :D Hope you guys enjoyed today’s Did You Know!! And don’t forget to keep an eye out for the next poll to choose your next Did You Know! :) <3

- Moderator Mollie <3 <3 <3

? Did You Know ? - Gulliver!

Gulliver is a seagull in the AC series, and he rewards the player with rare furniture items - often artefacts from around the world which cannot be obtained anywhere else in-game. Gulliver’s name is in reference to the famous book by Jonathan Swift - Gulliver’s travels, where a man named Gulliver travels to the far corners of the earth, before being shipwrecked and landing on a previously undiscovered land. There has also been a film adaptation of Gulliver’s travels recently (for those of you who are big on your movies), starring Jack Black :D And now back to the story! xD

Gulliver has appeared throughout the series, however has appeared differently in various games, so we’re firstly going to start with how most of us commonly know Gulliver.

Gulliver is, exactly as his inspiration, a sailor who washes up on the player’s beach in Animal Crossing GC (the original Gamecube game), as well as in Animal Crossing: New Leaf. He often appears dazed and sleepy, as if he’s just recovering from a big event at sea (such as a shipwreck) - which is why it takes the player several attempts at talking to him before he finally wakes up. In New Leaf, he quizzes the player on where he’s been, and it’s up to the player to correctly guess the country in order to receive the rare furniture item. In Animal Crossing GC, this is similar except for when the player travels to the island, they may see Gulliver floating in the water. When they return to their town, they will be able to find Gulliver on one of their beaches.

Now for those of you who played Wild World and City Folk, you were introduced to Gulliver’s highly interesting alter-ego. For those of you who don’t know, in Wild World and City Folk, Gulliver swapped the sea for space and flies around in a UFO. The player upon seeing the UFO in the sky can shoot it down with a slingshot (oh the old days of when you could fire a slingshot and watch it ping straight up into the sky for miles xD). Once the UFO crash lands, parts of the UFO are scattered around town for the player to find. Upon gathering all of these UFO parts and bringing them back to Gulliver, the player is then rewarded with rare furniture. In City Folk, he travels much faster so you have to be quick with your slingshot! He will crash land on the beach and this time only be missing one piece of his UFO, which can be exchanged for a rare furniture item.

Finally for those of you who have seen the Animal Crossing Movie, you will have also noticed Gulliver’s UFO makes an appearance yet again. Gulliver in the movie is said to be an alien, and he appears when his UFO crash lands into Animal Village, enlisting the help of the villagers to recover his missing UFO parts.

And that’s all on our favourite travelling Seagull! :D I did have a thought that it may have been in relation to Gulliver’s travels so I was pleased to find that link :D Hope you guys enjoyed today’s Did You Know!! And don’t forget to keep an eye out for the next poll to choose your next Did You Know! :) <3

- Moderator Mollie <3 <3 <3
trail.content:

And don’t forget to keep an eye out for the next poll to choose your next Did You Know! :) <3

- Moderator Mollie <3 <3 <3

summary: Ridley! My favourite Nintendo villain. He used to scare me a lot as a child. Still kinda does! This version is from Samus...
caption:
Ridley! My favourite Nintendo villain. He used to scare me a lot as a child. Still kinda does! This version is from Samus Returns. Never colored so much, especially metal, with copics. Alot of work! Hopefully the result is something everybody loves.
.
.
#myart #art #ridley #metroid #nintendo #samus #samusreturns #copic #markers #ink #abcdcolor #drawing #inktober #syls_followfriday #pen #smashbros
